Wikipedia Biography / Profile Background

Introduction :

Shawn Sanford, a man with thick, dark brown hair that is often seen sporting a short, scruffy beard, is the senior director of lifestyle marketing at Microsoft.

He is also the current husband of actress Poppy Montgomery.

Early Life and Education :

Shawn grew up in Washington state and never had too much of an inkling to live anywhere else.

He decided to stay in his home state for college, and attended the Pacific Lutheran University in Tacoma, Washington.

The small university is a private Lutheran-based school with an emphasis on community experiences, and often pushes their students to complete internships, just like Sanford did.

He began his time at Pacific Lutheran in 1990, and graduated in 1992 with a Bachelor’s degree in marketing.

Relationships and Married Life :

In 2011, Shawn Sanford met Poppy Montgomery in Puerto Rico, an actress that has been acting since the 1990s. She gained popularity in 2002 with the hit TV series Without a Trace, which starred her as a hard-hitting FBI agent.

She has gone on to act in multiple other roles, including a biopic movie about J.K. Rowling in which she played the famous author. She just recently finished up another TV series, Unforgettable.

He married Poppy Montgomery in 2014 at Disneyland. Together they have two children, a daughter named Violet Grace Deveraux & son Gus born in November 2014.

Poppy also has another kid – Jackson Phillip with old boyfriend Adam Kaufman.

The family often shares photos of their vacation & times together on their Instagram account.

Shawn Sanford Microsoft Career and Profession :

Aside from his time in college and any part-time jobs he had, all of Sanford’s career revolves around Microsoft.

In 1994, he got his first job with the company as a business development manager in Microsoft’s Internet Customer Unit.

There, he managed and built relationships with internet service providers, or ISPs, in both the US and in Canada.

Job Progress, Career and Net Worth :

In 1996, he was promoted to product manager in the company’s Department of Public Relations for Windows and Internet Explorer, two of Microsoft’s flagship programs.

Sanford handled press releases and sent out technical reports for Windows 98 and their corresponding Internet Explorer browser.

Two years later, in 1998, Sanford overhauled Microsoft’s public relations department and created the Communications and PR for Consumer Windows Division.

Through this division, he continued to manage Microsoft’s interactions with the press and with other forms of the media or clients.

In 1999, Shawn became the group manager for Microsoft’s new program, Windows XP.

In 2001, he turned his attention to small businesses and began managing the marketing teams for Microsoft’s small business partnerships.

Current Work :

In September of 2003, Sanford became the senior director of lifestyle marketing, where he leads teams in creating new marketing programs for the company.

He brings creativity into play and is trying to show Microsoft as a company that makes a great lifestyle companion to the everyday user, not just for people that have PC laptops.

He has held this position for over 14 years, and will probably continue to do so for many more years.
